DOC.brief_summary: The main objective study demonstrate non-inferiority intravenous paracetamol relative intravenous ketoprofen treat renal colic emergency ward . Efficacy measure change verbal numeric scale ( vns ) pain 30 minute .
DOC.brief_title: Intravenous Paracetamol Versus Ketoprofen When Treating Renal Colic Emergency Situations
DOC.detailed_description: The secondary objective study : - To compare efficacy ( non-inferiority ) intravenous paracetamol ketoprofen 90 minute ( vns pain ) . - To compare arm term administer drug ( pain ) . - To observe compare side effect two arm : cutaneous manifestation , edema , bronchospasm , nausea , vomit , headache , palpitation , chest pain , dizziness , disturbance consciousness , dyspnea , acute retention urine . - To determine predictor use intravenous morphine treat renal colic . - To compare hospitalization rate two group . - To compare patient satisfaction concern care two group ( vns satisfaction ) - To observe compare change towards complicate renal colic ( obstructive pyelonephritis , hyperalgesia , urinary tract rupture , need surgical drainage , sepsis , death )
DOC.criteria: The patient must give his/her inform sign consent The patient must insure beneficiary health insurance plan The patient available telephone interview week 1 Patient consult NÃ®mes University Hospital emergency ward suspicion renal colic The patient participate another study The patient exclusion period determine previous study The patient judicial protection , tutorship curatorship The patient refuse sign consent It impossible correctly inform patient The patient pregnant , parturient , breastfeed The patient contraindication treatment use study The patient allergy ketoprofen paracetamol , history gastric intestinal ulcer , bleed disorder , history asthma trigger take ketoprofen substance similar activity NSAIDs aspirin The patient fever hemodynamically unstable , oligoanuria The patient present initial verbal numeric pain score 10/10 . The patient history aneurysm aortic dissection , history renal transplantation , history renal hepatic insufficiency The patient take paracetamol ketoprofen 4 hour emergency treatment .
